post.summary: Adds a stream of Documents

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: (streaming inputs)

post.summary: backs up a resource (index) and it associated metadata e.g. settings, schema to s3
Backup warming queries to S3
Commits all pending changes to durable storage
Create an Index

Creates a snapshot in the index, which is saved point-in-time view of the last commit
in the index such that no files referenced by that snapshot will be deleted by ongoing
indexing until the snapshot is released with @releaseSnapshot.  Note that this will
reference the last commit, so be sure to call commit first if you have pending changes
that you'd like to be included in the snapshot.
This can be used for backup purposes, i.e. after creating the snapshot you can copy
all referenced files to backup storage, and then release the snapshot once complete.
To restore the backup, just copy all the files back and restart the server.
It can also be used for transactional purposes, i.e. if you sometimes need to search a
specific snapshot instead of the current live index. Creating a snapshot is very fast
(does not require any file copying), but over time it will consume extra disk space as
old segments are merged in the index.  Be sure to release the snapshot once you're done.
Snapshots survive shutdown and restart of the server.  Returns all protected filenames
referenced by this snapshot: these files will not change and will not be deleted until
the snapshot is released.  This returns the directories and files referenced by the snapshot.
Process request in a plugin which implements CustomRequestPlugin interface.
Delete documents
Delete all documents for index
Delete documents matching a query
Delete index

Forces merge policy to merge segments until there are <= maxNumSegments. The actual
merges to be executed are determined by the MergePolicy. This call will merge those
segments present in the index when the call started. If other threads are still
adding documents and flushing segments, those newly created segments will not be
merged unless you call forceMerge again.

Forces merging of all segments that have deleted documents. The actual merges to be
executed are determined by the MergePolicy. For example, the default TieredMergePolicy
will only pick a segment if the percentage of deleted docs is over 10%.
This method first flushes a new segment (if there are indexed documents), and applies
all buffered deletes.

get.summary: Gets all unreleased index gens of snapshots previously created with @createSnapshot.

get.summary:
Checks if a node is ready to receive traffic by checking if all the indices (which can be preloaded)
are started. Can specify comma-separated list of index name to only check specific indices if needed.

Checks if a node is ready to receive traffic by checking if all the indices (which can be preloaded)
are started. Can specify comma-separated list of index name to only check specific indices if needed.

post.summary: Refresh the latest searcher for an index

Registers one or more fields.  Fields must be registered before they can be added in a document (via @addDocument).
Pass a list of Fields and an indexName. Any number of fields may be registered in a single request,
and once a field is registered it cannot be changed (write-once).
This returns the full set of fields currently registered.
releases a snapshot previously created with @createSnapshot.
Reload state from the backend
Search

Change global offline settings for this index.
This returns the currently set settings; pass no settings changes to retrieve current settings.
Starts an index
Gets the state of a started index, includes settings, live_settings, search schema, suggest schema

Adds one or more fields.  Fields must be registered before they can be added in a document (via @addDocument).
Pass a list of Fields and an indexName. Any number of fields may be registered in a single request,
and once a field is registered it cannot be changed (write-once).
This returns the full set of fields currently registered.

parameters.name: indexName
parameters.description: Index name

parameters.name: liveSettings.maxRefreshSec
parameters.description: Longest time to wait before reopening IndexSearcher (i.e., periodic background reopen), default: 1.0.

parameters.name: liveSettings.minRefreshSec
parameters.description: Shortest time to wait before reopening IndexSearcher (i.e., when a search is waiting for a specific indexGen), default: 0.05.

parameters.name: liveSettings.maxSearcherAgeSec
parameters.description: Non-current searchers older than this are pruned, default: 60.0.

parameters.name: liveSettings.indexRamBufferSizeMB
parameters.description: Size (in MB) of IndexWriter's RAM buffer, default: 16.0.

parameters.name: liveSettings.addDocumentsMaxBufferLen
parameters.description: Max number of documents to add at a time, default: 100.

parameters.name: liveSettings.sliceMaxDocs
parameters.description: Maximum number of documents allowed in a parallel search slice, default: 250,000.

parameters.name: liveSettings.sliceMaxSegments
parameters.description: Maximum number of segments allowed in a parallel search slice, default: 5.

parameters.name: liveSettings.virtualShards
parameters.description: Number of virtual shards to use for this index, default: 1.

parameters.name: liveSettings.maxMergedSegmentMB
parameters.description: Maximum sized segment to produce during normal merging, default: 5GB.

parameters.name: liveSettings.segmentsPerTier
parameters.description: Number of segments per tier used by TieredMergePolicy, default: 10.

parameters.name: liveSettings.defaultSearchTimeoutSec
parameters.description: Timeout value to used when not specified in the search request, or 0 for no timeout, default: 0.

parameters.name: liveSettings.defaultSearchTimeoutCheckEvery
parameters.description: Timeout check every value to use when not specified in the search request, or 0 for none, default: 0.

parameters.name: liveSettings.defaultTerminateAfter
parameters.description: Terminate after value to use when not specified in the search request, or 0 for none, default: 0.

parameters.name: liveSettings.maxMergePreCopyDurationSec
parameters.description: Merge precopy would be stopped after this time, or 0 for no checks, default: 0.

post.summary: Search V2

Change global offline settings for this index.
This returns the currently set settings; pass no settings to retrieve current settings.

get.summary:
Change global offline settings for this index.
This returns the currently set settings; pass no settings to retrieve current settings.

parameters.name: indexName
parameters.description: Index name

parameters.name: settings.nrtCachingDirectoryMaxMergeSizeMB
parameters.description: Largest merged segment size to cache in RAMDirectory, default: 5.0MB.

parameters.name: settings.nrtCachingDirectoryMaxSizeMB
parameters.description: Largest overall size for all files cached in NRTCachingDirectory, default: 60.0MB.

parameters.name: settings.concurrentMergeSchedulerMaxThreadCount
parameters.description: How many merge threads to allow at once.

parameters.name: settings.concurrentMergeSchedulerMaxMergeCount
parameters.description: Maximum backlog of pending merges before indexing threads are stalled.

parameters.name: settings.indexMergeSchedulerAutoThrottle
parameters.description: Turn on/off the merge scheduler's auto throttling, default: off.

parameters.name: settings.directory
parameters.description: Base Directory implementation to use (NRTCachingDirectory will wrap this) either one of the core implementations (FSDirectory, MMapDirectory, NIOFSDirectory, SimpleFSDirectory, RAMDirectory (for temporary indices!) or a fully qualified path to a Directory implementation that has a public constructor taking a single File argument default: FSDirectory.

post.summary: Starts an index using configuration in IndexStartConfig

faceHierarchyPaths.title: Facet paths/hierarchy to bucket these values by, if indexed field is of type Facet.HIERARCHY

AddDocumentRequestMultiValuedField.description: we use this wrapper object to represent each field as a multivalued field.

BooleanClauseOccur.description: Defines how clauses may occur in matching documents. This will always be SHOULD by default.

nestedCollectorResults.description: Nested collector results for sub-aggregations of this bucket.

highlighter_type.description: Specify type of highlighter to use. Ignored right now in nrtsearch.

pre_tags.description: Used along with post_tags to specify how to wrap the highlighted text.

post_tags.description: Used along with pre_tags to specify how to wrap the highlighted text.

fragment_size.description: Number of characters in highlighted fragment, 100 by default. Set it to be 0 to fetch the entire field.

max_number_of_fragments.description: Maximum number of highlight fragments to return, 5 by default. If set to 0 returns entire text as a single fragment ignoring fragment_size.

highlight_query.description: Specify a query here if highlighting is desired against a different query than the search query.

field_match.description: Set to true to highlight fields only if specified in the search query.

score_ordered.title: Sorts highlighted fragments by score when set to true. By default, fragments will be output in the order they appear in the field. (Default is true)

fragmenter.description: Select Fragmenter between span (default) and simple. This is only applicable for plain highlighters.

discrete_multivalue.title: Let the fragment builder respect the multivalue fields. Each fragment won't cross multiple value fields if set true. (Default is false)

custom_highlighter_name.description: When highlighter_type is CUSTOM, use this string identifier to specify the highlighter. It is ignored for any other highlighter_types.

custom_highlighter_params.description: Optional Custom parameters for custom highlighters. If a field overriding is present, the global setting will be omitted for this field, and no merge will happen.

boundary_scanner.description: Define the boundary decision when creating fragments. Options are "simple" (default in fast vector highlighter), "word" or "sentence".

boundary_chars.description: Terminating chars when using "simple" boundary_scanner. The default is ".,!? \t\n".

boundary_max_scan.description: Number of chars to scan before finding the boundary_chars if using "simple" boundary scanner; If "boundary_chars" is not found after max scan, fragments will start/end at the original place. Default is 20.

boundary_scanner_locale.description: Locale used in boundary scanner when using "word" or "sentence" boundary_scanner. Examples: "en-US", "ch-ZH".

MultiFunctionScoreQueryBoostMode.description:
- BOOST_MODE_MULTIPLY: Multiply scores together
 - BOOST_MODE_SUM: Add scores together
 - BOOST_MODE_REPLACE: Ignore the query score, and use the function score only
MultiFunctionScoreQueryBoostMode.title: How to combine final function score with query score

filter.title: Apply function only to docs that pass this filter, match all if not specified

weight.title: Weight to multiply with function score, 1.0 if not specified

script.title: Produce score with score script definition

MultiFunctionScoreQueryFilterFunction.title: Function to produce a weighted value

MultiFunctionScoreQueryFunctionScoreMode.description:
- SCORE_MODE_MULTIPLY: Multiply weighted function scores together
 - SCORE_MODE_SUM: Add weighted function scores together
MultiFunctionScoreQueryFunctionScoreMode.title: How to combine multiple function scores to produce a final function score

MultiMatchQueryMatchType.description:
Type defining the execution behavior of the match.

 - BEST_FIELDS: Finds documents which match any field, but uses the _score from the best field.
 - PHRASE_PREFIX: Runs a MatchPhrasePrefixQuery query on each field and uses the _score from the best field.
 - CROSS_FIELDS: Finds documents that match across multiple fields, as if they were a single field.

terminated.description: If collection for this index slice was terminated early, such as by a timeout.

totalCollectedCount.title: Total docs collected by this collector

totalCollectTimeMs.title: Sum of all segment collection time
Total time for all document collection

totalReduceTimeMs.title: Total time to reduce results from all parallel search slices

relativeStartTimeMs.title: Start time of segment processing in relation to the start of the search phase

parsedQuery.title: Query debug has been moved to ProfileResult

highlights.title: Field name to highlighted text fragments

TotalHitsRelation.description:
* How the {TotalHits#value} should be interpreted.

 - EQUAL_TO: The total hit count is equal to {@link TotalHits#value}.
 - GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO: The total hit count is greater than or equal to {@link TotalHits#value}.

content_type.description: The HTTP Content-Type header value specifying the content type of the body.

data.description: The HTTP request/response body as raw binary.

extensions.description:
Application specific response metadata. Must be set in the first response
for streaming APIs.

primaryId.title: Unique identifier for the primary instance that processed the request

luceneserverAnalyzingSuggester.title: Suggester that first analyzes the surface form, adds the analyzed form to a weighted FST, and then does the same thing at lookup time (see @lucene:suggest:org.apache.lucene.search.suggest.analyzing.AnalyzingSuggester

luceneserverBooleanQuery.description: A query that matches documents using boolean combinations of other queries.

key.description: What to use for sorting. This can be _count for Bucket count, or the name of a nested collector that supports ordering.

luceneserverBucketOrder.description: Defines how Buckets should be ordered in BucketResult.

totalBuckets.description: Number of unique buckets, including those not in the buckets list.

totalOtherCounts.description: Number of other collected counts not represented in the buckets' counts.

infixSuggester.title: A suggester that matches terms anywhere in the input text, not just as a prefix. (see @lucene:org:server.InfixSuggester)

analyzingSuggester.title: Suggester that first analyzes the surface form, adds the analyzed form to a weighted FST, and then does the same thing at lookup time (see @lucene:suggest:org.apache.lucene.search.suggest.analyzing.AnalyzingSuggester

completionInfixSuggester.title: A suggester that matches terms anywhere in the input text. The implementation is different from InfixSuggester

fuzzyInfixSuggester.description: A suggester that matches fuzzy terms in the input text.

sequence number of the last operation in the commit.  All sequence numbers less than this value

luceneserverCompletionInfixSuggester.title: A suggester that matches terms anywhere in the input text. The implementation is different from InfixSuggester

- PREFIX_QUERY: PrefixCompletionQuery within ContextCompletionQuery

luceneserverConstantScoreQuery.description: Query that produces a score of 1.0 (modifiable by query boost value) for documents that match the filter query.

luceneserverCopyState.description: Holds incRef'd file level details for one point-in-time segment infos on the primary node.

existsWithId.description: Set if state/data already exists in the data backend. Provides the UUID to identify and load the index.

start.title: If this index should also be started, using IndexStartConfig configuration

luceneserverCreateSnapshotRequest.description:
Creates a snapshot in the index, which is saved point-in-time view of the last commit in the index such that no files referenced by that snapshot will be deleted by ongoing indexing until the snapshot is released with @releaseSnapshot. Note that this will reference the last commit, so be sure to call commit first if you have pending changes that you'd like to be included in the snapshot.

This can be used for backup purposes, i.e. after creating the snapshot you can copy all referenced files to backup storage, and then release the snapshot once complete. To restore the backup, just copy all the files back and restart the server. It can also be used for transactional purposes, i.e. if you sometimes need to search a specific snapshot instead of the current live index.

Creating a snapshot is very fast (does not require any file copying), but over time it will consume extra disk space as old segments are merged in the index. Be sure to release the snapshot once you're done. Snapshots survive shutdown and restart of the server. Returns all protected filenames referenced by this snapshot: these files will not change and will not be deleted until the snapshot is released. This returns the directories and files referenced by the snapshot.

luceneserverDisjunctionMaxQuery.description:
A query that generates the union of documents produced by its subqueries, and that scores each document with the
maximum score for that document as produced by any subquery, plus a tie breaking increment for any additional matching subqueries.

luceneserverExistsQuery.description: A query that matches documents which contain a value for a field.

luceneserverFacetType.description: Whether/How this field should index facets, and how.

analyzer.title: TODO make analyzers message types i.e. StandardAnalyzer, EnglishAnalyzer, CustomAnalyzer etc

similarity.title: TODO make similarity message types i.d. DefaultSimilarity, CustomSimilarity, BM25Similarity;

eagerFieldGlobalOrdinals.description: If field based global ordinals should be built up front, otherwise this is done lazily on first access. Currently only for fields with text doc values (TEXT/ATOM).

luceneserverFieldType.description:
- VIRTUAL: TODO name this "dynamic" instead of "virtual"?
 - INTERNAL: TODO need tests for internal:
 - VECTOR: List of float values
luceneserverFieldType.title: Type of the field

query.description: Only propagate documents that match the given query.

setQuery.description: Specialized implementation for set queries, checks if field doc values are in the provided set. This can be useful for large set sizes with lower recall, where building the scorer would be expensive.

luceneserverFilterCollector.description: Definition of filtering collector, there must be at least one nested collector specified in the Collector message.

docCount.description: Number of documents that passed the filter.

luceneserverFunctionFilterQuery.title: A query that retrieves all documents with a positive score calculated by the script

luceneserverFunctionScoreQuery.description: A query that wraps another query and uses custom scoring logic to compute the wrapped query's score.

luceneserverFuzzyInfixSuggester.title: A suggester that matches fuzzy terms in the input text

nrtCachingDirectoryMaxMergeSizeMB.title: Largest merged segment size to cache in RAMDirectory, default: 5.0MB

nrtCachingDirectoryMaxSizeMB.title: Largest overall size for all files cached in NRTCachingDirectory, default: 60.0MB

concurrentMergeSchedulerMaxThreadCount.title: How many merge threads to allow at once

concurrentMergeSchedulerMaxMergeCount.title: Maximum backlog of pending merges before indexing threads are stalled

indexSort.title: Index time sorting; can only be written once", SearchHandler.SORT_TYPE

indexMergeSchedulerAutoThrottle.title: Turn on/off the merge scheduler's auto throttling, default: off

directory.title: Base Directory implementation to use (NRTCachingDirectory will wrap this) either one of the core implementations (FSDirectory, MMapDirectory, NIOFSDirectory, SimpleFSDirectory, RAMDirectory (for temporary indices!) or a fully qualified path to a Directory implementation that has a public constructor taking a single File argument default: FSDirectory

luceneserverInfixSuggester.title: A suggester that matches terms anywhere in the input text, not just as a prefix. (see @lucene:org:server.InfixSuggester)

query_nested_path.description: Nested path to search against assuming same index as the parent Query.

start_hit.title: Which hit to start from (for pagination); default: 0

top_hits.description: How many top hits to retrieve; default: 3. It limits the hits returned, starting from index 0. For pagination: set it to startHit + window_size.

retrieve_fields.description: Fields to retrieve; Parent's fields except its id field are unavailable in the innerHit.

query_sort.description: Sort hits by field (default is by relevance).

luceneserverIntObject.title: Used to be able to check if a value was set

maxRefreshSec.description: Longest time to wait before reopening IndexSearcher (i.e., periodic background reopen).

minRefreshSec.description: Shortest time to wait before reopening IndexSearcher (i.e., when a search is waiting for a specific indexGen).

maxSearcherAgeSec.description: Non-current searchers older than this are pruned.

indexRamBufferSizeMB.description: Size (in MB) of IndexWriter's RAM buffer.

addDocumentsMaxBufferLen.description: Max number of documents to add at a time.

sliceMaxDocs.description: Maximum number of documents allowed in a parallel search slice.

sliceMaxSegments.description: Maximum number of segments allowed in a parallel search slice.

virtualShards.description: Number of virtual shards to use for this index.

maxMergedSegmentMB.title: Maximum sized segment to produce during normal merging

segmentsPerTier.title: Number of segments per tier used by TieredMergePolicy

defaultSearchTimeoutSec.description: Timeout value to used when not specified in the search request.

defaultSearchTimeoutCheckEvery.description: Timeout check every value to use when not specified in the search request.

defaultTerminateAfter.description: Terminate after value to use when not specified in the search request.

liveSettings.title: Live settings to merge into existing live settings, or unset to get current live settings
Current live settings, including default values

field.description: Field in the document to query.

slop.description: Edit distance between respective positions of tokens generated by analyzing this query and the positions of terms in a document.

analyzer.description: Analyzer used to analyze the query. If not provided, the default search analyzer for the field would be used instead.

max_expansions.description: Maximum number of terms to which the last provided term of the query value will expand. Defaults to 50.

luceneserverMatchPhrasePrefixQuery.title: A query that matches documents containing terms in the same order as those in the analyzed query string. The final analyzed token is treated as a prefix

luceneserverMatchPhraseQuery.description: A query that analyzes the text before finding matching documents. The tokens resulting from the analysis are combined into a PhraseQuery.

luceneserverMatchQuery.description: A query that analyzes the text before finding matching documents. The tokens resulting from the analysis are combined using term queries in boolean clauses.

script.title: Script to produce a double value

luceneserverMaxCollector.description: Definition of collector to find a max double value over documents. Currently only allows for script based value production.

query.title: Main query to produce recalled docs and scores, which will be modified by the final function score

functions.title: Functions to produce final function score

boost_mode.title: Method to modify query document scores with final function score

min_score.description: Optional minimal score to match a document. By default, it's 0.

min_excluded.title: Determine minimal score is excluded or not. By default, it's false;

luceneserverMultiFunctionScoreQuery.title: A query to modify the score of documents with a given set of functions

type.description: Type defining match behavior of query.

slop.description: Edit distance between respective positions of tokens generated by analyzing this query and the positions of terms in a document, applies to PHRASE_PREFIX type matching.

maxExpansions.description: Maximum number of terms to which the prefix token will expand when using PHRASE_PREFIX matching. Defaults to 50.

luceneserverMultiMatchQuery.description: A query that creates a match query for each field provided and wraps all the match queries in a disjunction max query.

suggestLookupHighlight.title: Expert: custom Object to hold the result of a highlighted suggestion (currently only works with AnalyzingInfixSuggester)

slop.description:
Edit distance between respective positions of terms as defined in this PhraseQuery and the positions
of terms in a document.

luceneserverPhraseQuery.description: A Query that matches documents containing a particular sequence of terms.

luceneserverPluginCollector.title: Defines an entry point for using a collector from a plugin

luceneserverPluginRescorer.title: Defines an entry point for using a rescorer from plugin

rewrite.description: Method used to rewrite the query.

rewriteTopTermsSize.description: Specifies the size to use for the TOP_TERMS* rewrite methods.

luceneserverPrefixQuery.description: A query that matches documents that contain a specific prefix in a provided field.

luceneserverProfileResult.title: Defines detailed profiling stats for queries that set profile=true

luceneserverQuery.description: Defines a full query consisting of a QueryNode which may be one of several types.

luceneserverQueryRescorer.title: Defines a rescorer which uses query to rescore documents in the second pass

luceneserverRangeQuery.description: A query that matches documents with values within the specified range. The lower and upper values though provided as strings will be converted to the type of the field. This works with INT, LONG, FLOAT, DOUBLE and DATE_TIME field types.

seqNum.title: sequence number for this chunk, only used for acked file copy

ack.title: if this chunk should be acked, only used for acked file copy

name.title: Must be unique for each Rescorer

luceneserverRescorer.title: Defines a rescorer which is executed after the first search pass

luceneserverRewriteMethod.description:
- CONSTANT_SCORE: Uses the CONSTANT_SCORE_BOOLEAN method for fewer matching terms. Otherwise, this method finds all matching terms in sequence and returns matching documents using a bit set.
 - CONSTANT_SCORE_BOOLEAN: This method changes the original query to a BooleanQuery, containing a SHOULD clause and TermQuery for each matching term.
 - SCORING_BOOLEAN: This method changes the original query to a BooleanQuery, containing a SHOULD clause and TermQuery for each matching term. Calculates the relevance score for each matching document.
 - TOP_TERMS_BLENDED_FREQS: This method changes the original query to a BooleanQuery, containing a SHOULD clause and TermQuery for each matching term. Calculates a relevance score for each matching document as if all terms had the same frequency, the maximum frequency of all matching terms. The final BooleanQuery query only includes Term queries for the top N (specified separately) scoring terms.
 - TOP_TERMS_BOOST: This method changes the original query to a BooleanQuery, containing a SHOULD clause and TermQuery for each matching term. Assigns each matching document a relevance score equal to the boost parameter. The final BooleanQuery query only includes Term queries for the top N (specified separately) terms.
 - TOP_TERMS: This method changes the original query to a BooleanQuery, containing a SHOULD clause and TermQuery for each matching term. Calculates a relevance score for each matching document. The final BooleanQuery query only includes Term queries for the top N (specified separately) scoring terms.
luceneserverRewriteMethod.title: Method used to rewrite a MultiTermQuery

timeoutSec.description:
Maximum number of seconds spent on each collection phase; note that for
multi-pass searches (e.g. query-time grouping), this timeout applies to each phase.

profile.title: If detailed request execution profiling should be included in the response

timeoutCheckEvery.description: Check the search timeout condition after each collection of n documents in a segment. If 0, timeout is only checked on the segment boundary.

collectors.description: Additional document collectors. Provides support for operations such as aggregation.

terminateAfter.description: Stop document collection in search phase after this many documents, 0 for unlimited.

responseCompression.title: Set gRPC compression codec to use for response message. If value is unset or invalid, falls back to uncompressed. Valid codecs: identity, gzip, lz4

highlight.title: Specify how to highlight matched text

explain.title: If Lucene explanation should be included in the response

inner_hits.title: Search nested object fields for each hit

profileResult.title: Detailed stats returned when profile=true in request

collectorResults.title: Results from any additional document collectors

terminatedEarly.title: If this query hit the terminateAfter threshold specified in the request

version.description:
the version recorded in the commit that the reader opened.
This version is advanced every time a change is made with IndexWriter.

luceneserverSelector.title: For multi valued fields, how to select which value is used for sorting

directory.title: Base Directory implementation to use (NRTCachingDirectory will wrap this) either one of the core implementations (FSDirectory, MMapDirectory, NIOFSDirectory, SimpleFSDirectory, RAMDirectory (for temporary indices!) or a fully qualified path to a Directory implementation that has a public constructor taking a single File argument default: FSDirectory

settings.title: Settings to merge into existing settings, or unset to get current settings
Current index settings, including default values

luceneserverSortFields.title: Fields to sort on either during index time or search time

missingLat.description:
Whether missing values should sort last instead of first.
Note that this runs \"before\" reverse, so if you sort missing first and reverse=true then missing values will
be at the end.

reverse.title: Sort in reverse of the field's natural order

luceneserverSortType.description: "The field to sort on. Pass docid for index order and score for relevance sort.

primaryDiscoveryFile.title: replica, location of discovery file containing primary host/port. Used if primaryAddress is empty. If port is specified in this request, it overrides the value in the file

luceneserverStartIndexV2Request.title: Start the index using IndexStartConfig configuration

maxDoc.description:
The total number of docs in this index, including docs not yet flushed (still in the RAM buffer),
not counting deletions.

numDocs.description:
*
The total number of docs in this index, including
docs not yet flushed (still in the RAM buffer), and
including deletions. NOTE: buffered deletions
are not counted.  If you really need these to be
counted you should call {@link IndexWriter#commit()} first.

localFile.description:
Local file (to the server) to read suggestions + weights from; format is weight U+001F suggestion U+001F payload,
one per line, with suggestion UTF-8 encoded. If this option is used then searcher, suggestField,
weightField/Expression, payloadField should not be specified.

field.description: Field in the document to query.

luceneserverTermInSetQuery.description: Specialization for a disjunction over many terms that behaves like a ConstantScoreQuery over a BooleanQuery containing only BooleanClause.Occur.SHOULD clauses. Only ONE of the types of terms needs to be provided - the one that matches the type of the field.

field.description: Field in the document to query.

textValue.description: TEXT FieldType term to search for.

intValue.description: INT FieldType term to search for.

longValue.description: LONG FieldType term to search for.

floatValue.description: FLOAT FieldType term to search for.

doubleValue.description: DOUBLE FieldType term to search for.

booleanValue.description: BOOLEAN FieldType term to search for.

luceneserverTermQuery.description: A query that matches documents containing a term.

luceneserverTermVectors.description: Whether/how term vectors should be indexed.

script.description: Use FacetScript definition to produce terms.

size.description: Maximum number of top terms to return.

order.description: How results Buckets should be ordered, defaults to descending Bucket _count.

startHit.description: Offset for retrieval of top hits.

topHits.description: Total hits to collect, note that the number of hits returned is (topHits - startHit).

querySort.description: When specified, collector does sort based collection. Otherwise, relevance score is used.

explain.title: If Lucene explanation should be included in the collector response

luceneserverTopHitsCollector.description: Definition of top hits based collector.

value.description: * The value of the total hit count. Must be interpreted in the context of * {#relation}.

type_url.description:
A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized
protocol buffer message. This string must contain at least
one "/" character. The last segment of the URL's path must represent
the fully qualified name of the type (as in
`path/google.protobuf.Duration`). The name should be in a canonical form
(e.g., leading "." is not accepted).

In practice, teams usually precompile into the binary all types that they
expect it to use in the context of Any. However, for URLs which use the
scheme `http`, `https`, or no scheme, one can optionally set up a type
server that maps type URLs to message definitions as follows:

* If no scheme is provided, `https` is assumed.
* An HTTP GET on the URL must yield a [google.protobuf.Type][]
  value in binary format, or produce an error.
* Applications are allowed to cache lookup results based on the
  URL, or have them precompiled into a binary to avoid any
  lookup. Therefore, binary compatibility needs to be preserved
  on changes to types. (Use versioned type names to manage
  breaking changes.)

Note: this functionality is not currently available in the official
protobuf release, and it is not used for type URLs beginning with
type.googleapis.com.

Schemes other than `http`, `https` (or the empty scheme) might be
used with implementation specific semantics.

value.description: Must be a valid serialized protocol buffer of the above specified type.

protobufNullValue.description:
`NullValue` is a singleton enumeration to represent the null value for the
`Value` type union.

 The JSON representation for `NullValue` is JSON `null`.

 - NULL_VALUE: Null value.

latitude.description: The latitude in degrees. It must be in the range [-90.0, +90.0].

longitude.description: The longitude in degrees. It must be in the range [-180.0, +180.0].

typeLatLng.description: An object representing a latitude/longitude pair. This is expressed as a pair of doubles representing degrees latitude and degrees longitude. Unless specified otherwise, this must conform to the WGS84 standard. Values must be within normalized ranges.
